Message.Title: Chicago Democrats set a milestone.
Message.Msg: Chicago police confirm 500th homicide for 2012 Published December 29, 2012 Associated Press CHICAGO – Chicago Police Superintendent Garry McCarthy says the city has logged its 500th homicide of the year. McCarthy issued a statement Friday calling the milestone a "tragic number that is reflective of the gang violence and proliferation of illegal guns that have plagued some of our neighborhoods. Obama's folks just keep icing each other. Assault Rifle bans and other gun control laws won't solve this problem. We need our Community Organizer back."

Message.Title: $1 Trillion Obamacare Tax Hike Hitting on Jan. 1
Message.Msg: Obamacare contains twenty new or higher taxes. Five of the taxes hit for the first time on January 1. In total, for the years 2013-2022, Americans face a net $1 trillion tax hike for the years 2013-2022, according to the Congressional Budget Office. The five major Obamacare taxes taking effect on January are as follows: The Obamacare Medical Device Tax: Medical device manufacturers employ 409,000 people in 12,000 plants across the country. Obamacare imposes a new 2.3 percent excise tax on gross sales – even if the company does not earn a profit in a given year. In addition to killing small business jobs and impacting research and development budgets, this will increase the cost of your health care – making everything from pacemakers to artificial hips more expensive. Read more:

Topic.Title: lemmings like zevoter don't realize the govt is operating on the RYAN budget

Message.Msg: From the National Journal Sept, 2012 "Forced to vote in the middle of the night due to procedural hurdles, the Senate early on Saturday morning passed a continuing resolution, 62-30, to keep the government funded through late March at an annual rate of $1.047 trillion. President Obama is expected to sign the stopgap bill shortly. That figure, consistent with the fiscal 2013 cap set by the Budget Control Act, an increase of about $8 billion over fiscal 2012, is $19 billion higher than the fiscal 2013 discretionary cap the House GOP passed in the spring." There is no bidget.. Just continuing resolutions. It would be a good idea to check in with reality.

WHY CAN'T CONGRSSS GET IT DONE!!! BUMS!!! ALL BUMS!!!-jmho-bucko

Topic.Title: lemmings like zevoter don't realize the govt is operating on the RYAN budget

Message.Msg: Lib, I was responding to the fatuous notion that the gov't was operating under the "Ryan budget." The house in good faith has passed over budgets and Pinky has pocketed them for the past three years. It seems to me he should respect the constitution and come up with a senate version of the budget and throw it into conference committee and get it passed. I can certainly understand why big gov't advocates love the continuing resolution process. And the repubs are certainly abetting thwarting the constitution by passing the bloated continuing resolutions. As far as "pig heded obstructionists" the chief pig head obstructionist is sitting in the oval offfice.
